page.title: 18Treetops 'Hospital'.
page.content: There was once a country nursing home for crippled children .It was opened in{1913}but is now run by {Stockport Area Health Authority.}It is a family support unit, and provides places for children who are both {mentally and physically handicapped. It does not have wards but is made up of self-contained units or homes, having a lounge, dining area, kitchen, bedrooms and bathroom to make the children feel 'at home'. Half the places are taken up by children who{live a Treetops}and the rest provide care for children who {live at home.}Children with very special needs come here whilst parents have a well earned holiday. Children who attend Treetops are all from the{Stockport area.}Their needs and rights are the same as all other childrens.
